prompt:
I have the following count table for an RNA-seq experiment, rows are genes and columns are samples,"Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx". The first column of the file is my gene names and the rest of the columns are samples. My annotation data is here "SRP021193.colData.tsv", it contains sample annotations and rows of this matches the columns of count table, first column is the sample ids. Normalize counts, make two PCA plots for samples, one color coded samples by "group" and the other color coded by "LibrarySelection" in my annotation data.

response:
```
#Load required libraries
library(readxl)
library(RColorBrewer)
library(ggplot2)
library(ggrepel)
library(DESeq2)

# Read count table
count_table <- read_excel("Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx")

# Read annotation data
annotation_data <- read.table("SRP021193.colData.tsv", header = T, sep = "\t")

# Set row names of count table as gene names
rownames(count_table) <- count_table[,1]

# Remove first column (gene names) from count table
count_table <- count_table[,-1]

# Check the structure of count table
str(count_table)

# Normalize count table using DESeq2
dds <- DESeqDataSetFromMatrix(countData = count_table, colData = annotation_data, design = ~ 1)
dds <- DESeq(dds)
normalized_counts <- counts(dds, normalized = TRUE)

# Perform PCA on normalized counts
pca_data <- prcomp(t(normalized_counts), scale = TRUE)

# Create a dataframe with PCA results and annotation data
pca_df <- data.frame(pca_data$x, annotation_data)

# Plot PCA grouped by "group"
pca_plot_group <- ggplot(pca_df, aes(PC1, PC2, color = group)) +
  geom_point(size = 5) +
  geom_text_repel(aes(label = rownames(pca_df)), size = 3, force = 5) +
  scale_color_brewer(palette = "Set1") +
  labs(title = "PCA Plot (Group)",
       x = "PC1",
       y = "PC2")

# Plot PCA grouped by "LibrarySelection"
pca_plot_library_sel <- ggplot(pca_df, aes(PC1, PC2, color = LibrarySelection)) +
  geom_point(size = 5) +
  geom_text_repel(aes(label = rownames(pca_df)), size = 3, force = 5) +
  scale_color_brewer(palette = "Set2") +
  labs(title = "PCA Plot (Library Selection)",
       x = "PC1",
       y = "PC2")

# Display the PCA plots
pca_plot_group
pca_plot_library_sel
```
